author: Jeff Parsons
title: Modern tech keeping you awake? This new research into sleep may shock you
text:
If you feel like modern life, with its electric lighting, internet and massively multiplayer online games is ruining your sleep pattern , this new research may come as a shock.
According to a report published in the journal Current Biology , our hunter-gatherer ancestors only got around 6.5 hours of sleep themselves.
Researchers in the US arrived at the conclusion after studying three different tribes living without modern technology.
The team recorded 98 people for 1,165 nights using sleep trackers and found they only slept for an average of 6.5 hours each night. Rather than go to sleep when the sun set, they often lit fires and stayed up late.
Getty Baffling: This chap probably got around the same amount of sleep you do
"All three groups have pretty much the same sleep duration and pretty much the same timing of sleep," said Professor Jerome Siegel from the University of California, Los Angeles, who led the study.
"This gives me reasonable confidence that they reflect the common human biology and they are not a function of their particular situations, which are different," he said.
The only factor which did influence was temperature - the team found that on average the tribes slept for 55 minutes longer during the winter.
"What is absolutely clear is that they don't sleep more than we do," said Professor Siegel.
In fact, according to the authors of the study, the common complaint that the "modern world" reduces our ability to sleep has been recorded as far back as the 1880s.
Of course, there are plenty of modern gadgets available to help you sleep better .
